intro: Antirrhinum calycinum var. leiocarpum, commonly known as the smooth-seeded snapdragon, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe and western Asia. It belongs to the Plantaginaceae family and is characterized by its showy, bilaterally symmetrical flowers that come in a variety of colors. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and produces linear, lance-shaped leaves. Its flowers are tubular at the base and flare out into two lips, with the upper lip being shorter than the lower one. This variety is distinguished by its smooth, hairless seeds, which set it apart from other varieties within the species.
